div1.p: Darling discusses the pathological reports of a possible yellow fever case in Lagos, Nigeria.

div1.head: Letter from Samuel T. Darling to Frederick F. Russell, March 30, 1923
div1.p:
I have just examined sections of tissue from
the case of suspected yellow fever from Nigeria Case:
Bradinelli, Italian Merchant, died Warri Hospital, November
11, 1922.

Material had been sent to Dr. Noguchi who kindly
sent some specimens to me at Dr. Rose's request.

The liver is the most important organ in diagnosis
and I have examined several sections without finding any of
the characteristic lesions of yellow fever.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (Signed) SAMUEL T. DARLING. Dr. F. F. Russell, Director
International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York City.
